page.title: 16Downstream on the Lydd
page.content: From the stepping stones on the Lydd it is a pleasant walk down the banks of the river. Many tourists and native Devonians come here to soak in the sun and splash in the water. They do not go far from their car though. There is memorial here. In a cliff above the river, commanding a magnificent view of Brat Tor is the memorial to Captain Nigel Hunter. He was in the Royal Engineers, and was awarded the Military Cross and bar. He was killed in action on March 25th 1918 aged 23 years. The memorial is a plaque attached to the rock. Under the plaque is a seat, now much in needs of repair. What Captain Hunter did to win his medals, and why the plaque is there I do not know. It is an idictment of the madness of war, that a young man should be cut down in his prime.
